timeline.bodyText: What if type == TYPE_BINARY_COMPRESSED? Is there any test to verify comparing of compressed keys?
timeline.author: agura

replies.bodyText: If type is CacheObject.TYPE_BINARY_COMPRESSED then regular non-optimized comparison takes place, such as with keys larger than page - fetch both entries off PDS, unwrap, compare.
replies.author: alamar

timeline.bodyText: Why it is critical if compressionStrategy couldn't be closed? May be close-quite semantic is more suitable here. WDYT?
timeline.author: agura
agura

timeline.bodyText:
Please, don't use nonNull in such cases. Most code uses val != null and there is no any reason for change this style.
Use nonNull only as simple lambda-expressions (see corresponding javadoc).
timeline.author: agura

timeline.bodyText: Looks like a copy-paste error here: we pass compressKeys flag when preparing value, not key.
